name: Mexican Cuban Sandwich
description: A delicious update on the classic Cuban Sandwich.  We are using pickled jalapenos and chipotle mayo in place of the pickles and mustard.  Works great with leftover carnitas!
recipeIngredient: 1 cup cooked carnitas or roast pork

recipeInstructions.text: (This recipe is using cooked carnitas from this slow cooker carnitas recipe but you can use any roast or pulled pork that is already cooked).
recipeInstructions.name: (This recipe is using cooked carnitas from this slow cooker carnitas recipe but you can use any roast or pulled pork that is already cooked).

recipeInstructions.text: If you are warming up the carnitas, heat up a dollop of oil in a skillet over medium heat.  Add a heaping cup of carnitas and cook until the underside is crisping up, approximately 5-7 minutes.  You can add the ham slices to the pan for the last couple minutes of cooking if you want.
recipeInstructions.name: If you are warming up the carnitas, heat up a dollop of oil in a skillet over medium heat.  Add a heaping cup of carnitas and cook until the underside is crisping up, approximately 5-7 minutes.  You can add the ham slices to the pan for the last couple minutes of cooking if you want.

recipeInstructions.text: For the Chipotle Mayo, combine the listed ingredients in a blender or food processor.   Taste for heat level and seasoning.
recipeInstructions.name: For the Chipotle Mayo, combine the listed ingredients in a blender or food processor.   Taste for heat level and seasoning.

recipeInstructions.text: Each sandwich gets a layer of chipotle mayo, diced pickled jalapenos, cheese, pork or carnitas, and 2 ham slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Each sandwich gets a layer of chipotle mayo, diced pickled jalapenos, cheese, pork or carnitas, and 2 ham slices.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the sandwiches in a skillet over medium-low heat for 3-4 minutes per side.  Press down on the sandwiches with a casserole dish or pan to compress them.   You can also add a thin layer of butter to the skillet if you want to crisp up the edges of the sandwich.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the sandwiches in a skillet over medium-low heat for 3-4 minutes per side.  Press down on the sandwiches with a casserole dish or pan to compress them.   You can also add a thin layer of butter to the skillet if you want to crisp up the edges of the sandwich.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut in half and serve immediately with the chipotle mayo and pickled jalapenos on standby to add to future bites if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut in half and serve immediately with the chipotle mayo and pickled jalapenos on standby to add to future bites if needed.
